repnme.cdata!: China - Third Henan Provincial Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the China Third Henan
            Provincial Highway Project were as follows: outcomes for the
            first project were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satsifactory.
            Some lessons learned included: 1) in spite of a broad range
            of topics, complex issues and many stakeholders,
            institutional strengthening can be successful; 2) the Bank
            should pay more attention to the impact of the construction
            works on safety and include mitigations measures during the
            construction phase; 3) the impact of high cement content
            (above 4.5 percent in weight) in base course remains a
            problem; and 4) even though many provinces in China are
            using state of the art equipment, few provincial and
            municipal systems are well integrated.

5086181.trustfund:
TF039128-CHINA - 3RD HENAN PROVINCIAL
            HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF040756-CHINA: THIRD HENAN HIGHWAY PROJECT
5086181.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rural development

repnme.cdata!: China - Third Henan Provincial Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Henan Provincial Highway
            Project aims at providing a more efficient and effective
            transport infrastructure in support of social and economic
            development in Henan Province. To meet this development
            objective, the project will produce the following outputs:
            reduced traffic and enhanced mobility, improved access to
            the poor areas in the province, and increased efficiency and
            effectiveness in public sector management of the road
            network while preparing the sector for commercialization
            opportunities. The project has three components. The first
            increases capacity by constructing an expressway; linking
            roads to maximize the impact of the expressway; and
            providing buildings/services areas, traffic engineering and
            equipment for operations and maintenance. The second
            component improves or rehabilitates roads with priority
            given to rural road segments that explicitly enable local
            people to have an easier access to education, health, and
            other social activities and facilitates production and
            business operations and benefits the local environment. The
            third component includes three sub-components which 1) build
            the capacity of the communications department, and provide
            extensive training programs in the areas of environmental
            protection, construction and maintenance technology and
            management, highway network planning, and operations
            management for senior professionals; 2) supply technical
            assistance for studies in road management improvement; and
            3) provide specialized equipment

437713.trustfund:
TF040756-CHINA: THIRD HENAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF039128-CHINA - 3RD HENAN PROVINCIAL
            HIGHWAY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Third Henan Highway Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Third Henan Highway Project, which connecting roads
            linking the existing Zhumadian-Xinyang expressway with
            cities and towns and highway networks. Negative
            environmental impacts will be mitigated as follows: to
            control traffic noise, entrances to facilities will be built
            to avoid facing roads and fences alongside the road will be
            raised. Borrow pits filled with solid wastes will be located
            in wastelands or abandoned land whenever possible. Land will
            be cleared and recovered as soon as construction is
            completed. Temporary drains will prevent any surface runoff.
            Central lime soil mixing plants will be distanced from
            residential areas, earth roads will be watered, hauling
            trucks will be covered, and plant operators will wear
            protective gauze masks and goggles to reduce the impact of
            dust. Equipment delivering asphalt will be sealed and worker
            exposure to this substance will be reduced. Operators will
            be equipped with earplugs and construction activity will be
            regulated to reduce noise. Sewage will be treated before
            discharge, seepage controls employed, and refuse removed
            regularly. Cultural relics will be protected if unearthed.
            Exhaust gas will be monitored periodically. Slope protection
            works will be provided with grass planted to prevent
            instability and soil erosion.

436970.trustfund:
TF040756-CHINA: THIRD HENAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF039128-CHINA - 3RD HENAN PROVINCIAL
            HIGHWAY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Third Henan Highway Project :
            resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the resettlement action plan for
            the Third Henan Highway Project, which builds an expressway,
            linking highways and rural roads. Generally land requisition
            will be avoided where possible. The living standard,
            productive ability and income of projected affected persons
            (PAPs) will be restored to original levels. Removed
            buildings such as residences will be compensated according
            to reconstruction price. New houses for PAPs should be ready
            before demolition of their old houses and a removal expense
            paid. Transition costs will be supplied wherever needed.
            Requisitioned arable land (including vegetable plots,
            orchards, fish ponds, lotus ponds, and tea gardens in city
            suburbs under direct provincial administration, will be
            compensated according to annual output value. Annual output
            value will also be used to compensate land in industry and
            mining areas under direct administration of the county and
            land located elsewhere. Compensation for young crops will be
            made according to the output value of one harvest. Crop
            by-products (vegetables excluded) will be compensated by
            15-20 percent of the output they mainly produce. Land used
            for residence and collective land used for public
            facilities, commonwealth benefits, or used for individual
            business will be compensated as arable land and a removal
            subsidy will be given to land users. Resettlement subsidies
            will also be distributed. Land reclaimed after the project,
            if incapable of producing or not accepted, will be compensated.

TF040756-CHINA: THIRD HENAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF039128-CHINA - 3RD HENAN PROVINCIAL
            HIGHWAY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Third Henan Highway Project :
            resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the resettlement action plan for
            the Third Henan Highway Project, which builds an expressway,
            linking highways and rural roads. Generally land requisition
            will be avoided where possible. The living standard,
            productive ability and income of projected affected persons
            (PAPs) will be restored to original levels. Removed
            buildings such as residences will be compensated according
            to reconstruction price. New houses for PAPs should be ready
            before demolition of their old houses and a removal expense
            paid. Transition costs will be supplied wherever needed.
            Requisitioned arable land (including vegetable plots,
            orchards, fish ponds, lotus ponds, and tea gardens in city
            suburbs under direct provincial administration, will be
            compensated according to annual output value. Annual output
            value will also be used to compensate land in industry and
            mining areas under direct administration of the county and
            land located elsewhere. Compensation for young crops will be
            made according to the output value of one harvest. Crop
            by-products (vegetables excluded) will be compensated by
            15-20 percent of the output they mainly produce. Land used
            for residence and collective land used for public
            facilities, commonwealth benefits, or used for individual
            business will be compensated as arable land and a removal
            subsidy will be given to land users. Resettlement subsidies
            will also be distributed. Land reclaimed after the project,
            if incapable of producing or not accepted, will be compensated.

TF040756-CHINA: THIRD HENAN HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF039128-CHINA - 3RD HENAN PROVINCIAL

repnme.cdata!:
China - Third Henan Highway Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Third Henan Highway Project, which connecting roads
            linking the existing Zhumadian-Xinyang expressway with
            cities and towns and highway networks. Negative
            environmental impacts will be mitigated as follows: to
            control traffic noise, entrances to facilities will be built
            to avoid facing roads and fences alongside the road will be
            raised. Borrow pits filled with solid wastes will be located
            in wastelands or abandoned land whenever possible. Land will
            be cleared and recovered as soon as construction is
            completed. Temporary drains will prevent any surface runoff.
            Central lime soil mixing plants will be distanced from
            residential areas, earth roads will be watered, hauling
            trucks will be covered, and plant operators will wear
            protective gauze masks and goggles to reduce the impact of
            dust. Equipment delivering asphalt will be sealed and worker
            exposure to this substance will be reduced. Operators will
            be equipped with earplugs and construction activity will be
            regulated to reduce noise. Sewage will be treated before
            discharge, seepage controls employed, and refuse removed
            regularly. Cultural relics will be protected if unearthed.
            Exhaust gas will be monitored periodically. Slope protection
            works will be provided with grass planted to prevent
            instability and soil erosion.

            Project : environmental assessment : Summary
